name: VEHICULAR MECHANICAL ENERGY RECOVERY SYSTEM (VMERS)
description:
Brief Ideation of the VMERS.(Electricity generator)
STEP 1: Tire Contacts Roller
Two things happen simultaneously:
A) Roller rotates
B) Roller platform moves downward (2 cm)
PATH 1 : ROTATIONAL ENERGY EXTRACTION
Linear motion of tire causes the Rotation of Roller
Roller shaft rotates.
Then:
Shaft - Gear multiplication -Generator -Electricity.
PATH 2 : VERTICAL COMPRESSION ENERGY
Cycle weight applies normal force.
Roller platform moves down 2 cm.
Rack & pinion attached to vertical motion.
Downward movement: Rack moves. Pinion rotates. Pinion connected to generator.
Upward movement: Another rack or one-way clutch extracts energy again.
So compression + return both produce rotation.
So generator receives power from:
 1)Horizontal rolling
2)Vertical compression

name: StepCharge - Piezoelectric Tiles
description: The proposed idea involves developing piezoelectric tiles that convert mechanical energy into electrical energy. These flat-structured tiles generate power when stepped on and store it for later use. When installed in high footfall areas, such systems can collectively produce a significant amount of renewable energy.

name: FloodSense
description:
FloodSense is an intelligent urban resilience network that transforms ordinary streetlights into flood-monitoring sentinels. Using advanced automotive-grade radar and edge computing, it filters out false alarms—like moving vehicles—to deliver precise, real-time flood data.
Operating on renewable power, the system provides city officials with a live 3D visualization of rising waters, enabling proactive disaster response and safer navigation for citizens

name: Dewey: The Shelf Auditing Bot
description: In libraries, it is often observed that some books are accidentally misplaced by students and readers, making it difficult for others to find the books that they want. Our idea is to design a robot which goes around a library and identifies misplaced books in shelves. It reports the location of these misplaced books to the library authorities, hence decreasing the manual effort required by the staff. This can not only be implemented in our campus library, but in libraries all across India.

name: Real time mess occupancy, information and analytics system
description: The hostel mess experiences heavy crowding during peak hours, causing students to skip meals due to uncertainty about current occupancy. There is no real-time system to inform students about how many people are inside the mess at a given time. The objective is to design and implement an automated system that accurately counts the number of students entering and exiting the mess. The system should continuously update and display the current occupancy on a central display board to help students make informed decisions.

name: Smart Bicycle Rental System
description:
This project is a Smart Bicycle Rental System that allows users to rent cycles through a mobile application in a secure and automated way. Users log in to the app, view nearby available cycles on a Google Map, and select a specific cycle using its unique lock ID. Before starting the ride, the app records a short video of the cycle to document its condition and uploads it to cloud storage with a timestamp.
The backend verifies the request and sends an unlock command to a smart lock. The ride timer runs on the server to prevent manipulation. After returning the cycle, the user uploads another video, and the system calculates the total cost based on time used and any late fees. Payment is completed through an integrated gateway.
comments: We discussed this idea with Prof. Udit Bhatia, and he approved it verbally. But we are not sure, if we require a formal approval.

name: Sound Energy Harvesting and Data Collection - Analysis
description:
Our idea has three checkpoints - 
1. Using sensors we'll collect data about sound energy in our campus.
2. Make a device using which we can convert sound energy into usable energy while trying to maintain efficiency 
3. A website which will show the data collected and based on the analysis predict things like quiet hours, points of high noise, etc.
comments: Looking forward to execute this idea!
